UIC</span></div></div></div><h1>Charitable Giving at UIC</h1></div><div id="page"><div class="ptl_page"><div class="pg_alert"><div class=""><div class="ptl_portlet_vertical"><div class="ptl_top_portlet" style="display:none;"></div><span id="ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl09_lblGlobalContent"><p>NOTE: This first paragraph will not appear. Do not delete it. To display a text message on every page of the web site start a new paragraph below this one. To remove your message, remove all content other than this paragraph.</p></span>

</div></div></div><div class="pg_content"><div class=""><div class="ptl_portlet_vertical"><div class="ptl_top_portlet" style="display:none;"></div><div id="ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl13_divContent"><h2>Welcome to Your UIC Charitable Giving Resource Guide<a class="jumptag" name="sec01">&nbsp;</a></h2>
<p>Various units at UIC offer outlets for charitable contributions. There are opportunities to give one-time or annual monetary gifts to various organizations and causes throughout our state, community, and university.</p>
<p><strong>At the UIC level&hellip;</strong> Employee contributions can support the University as a whole or be directed to a certain group or unit. Through UIC Office of Vice Chancellor for Advancement  and the UI Foundation, giving websites offer a variety of directions for employee donations. By using UIC Search tool looking for &ldquo;Giving at UIC&rdquo;, additional units and departmental giving opportunities can be found. </p>
<ul>
    <li>UIC Advancement - <a href="http://advancement.uic.edu/">http://advancement.uic.edu/</a></li>
    <li>University of Illinois Foundation: <a href="http://www.uif.uillinois.edu/">http://www.uif.uillinois.edu/</a></li>
</ul>
<!--
<p>Visit the <a href="http://tigger.uic.edu/depts/development/giving/StartGivingUIC.html">Start Giving</a> site to see what areas are available for donations.Website instructions:</p>
<ul>
    <li>Select the college, school, or other area of the UIC Campus you wish to support from those listed.</li>
    <li>Once you make your selection and enter the amount of your gift, please click the "Continue" button</li>
</ul>
-->
<p><strong>At the national, state, and community level&hellip;</strong>&hellip; all UI campuses participate in the annual Campus Charitable Fund Drive (CCFD) in partnership with the State and University Employees Combined Appeal (SECA).</p>
<h2>UIC&rsquo;s Annual Campus Charitable Fund Drive (CCFD)<a class="jumptag" name="sec02">&nbsp;</a></h2>
<p>Each year, UIC employees can donate to a variety of charitable organizations through the annual State and University Employee Combined Appeal (SECA). Throughout the University of Illinois system, this fund drive is known as the Campus Charitable Fund Drive (CCFD). SECA is comprised of twelve Federation Charities, representing over 1,500 charitable agencies.</p>
<p>The fight against global warming, aiding victims of domestic violence, supporting our troops, aiding cancer research, or alleviating hunger in your community are just a sample of the over 1,500 causes seeking assistance through SECA charitable agencies.</p>
<p>At UIC, our goal is to continually increase employee participation and overall pledge dollars for the annual Campus Charitable Fund Drive. </p>
<p>To aid in this state and university-wide campaign, each UIC department is asked to designate a CCFD Ambassador to lead department employees through this annual donation cycle. Ambassadors are sent fund drive materials to aid them.</p>
<!--<p>UIC university departments/units each designate a CCFD Ambassador who will serve as the department leader, providing information and resources to assist in reaching unit and campus wide goals. CCFD Ambassadors will be invited to attend one to three CCFD Charity &amp; Information Fairs. During these fairs, charity representatives provide information and materials to acquaint CCFD Ambassadors with the member agencies and the many causes they represent. The UIC CCFD team will be available to answer questions about their role in the campaign. </p>-->
<p>The UIC Campus Charitable Fund Drive is coordinated by UIC Human Resources, Special Programs, in conjunction with the State of Illinois SECA charitable campaign.</p>
<h2>What is SECA?<a class="jumptag" name="sec03">&nbsp;</a></h2>
<ul>
    <li><strong>SECA is... &hellip;.The State and University Employees Combined Appeal</strong><br>
    <a href="http://www.illinois.gov/seca/Pages/default.aspx">http://www.illinois.gov/seca/Pages/default.aspx</a>
    </li>
    <li>A once-a-year cooperative &ldquo;on the job&rdquo; campaign that allows employees to conveniently give via a one-time donation or an ongoing payroll contribution. SECA and UIC&rsquo;s Campus Charitable Fund Drive combine the efforts of twelve Charity Federations with over 1,500 agencies.</li>
    <li>All charities and agencies have submitted audited financial statements and statements of their activities, as well as signatures from at least 4,000 state employees, to obtain the approval from the Office of the Comptroller to participate in SECA/CCFD.</li>
    <li>Annually, the State of Illinois SECA campaign raises approximately $3,000,000 for the participating SECA and member charities and over $58 million in support of charities since the annual fund drive began.</li>
</ul>
<a>
</a>
<h2><a>How Employees Can Donate</a><a class="jumptag" name="sec04">&nbsp;</a></h2>
<p>There are two ways for UIC employees to contribute during the annual CCFD campaign. <strong>See Pledge Form section below for the CCFD pledge form and instructions. </strong></p>
<ol>
    <li><strong>Continuous payroll deduction:</strong>Employees who contribute through continuous payroll deduction have a designated amount withdrawn from their check each pay period. Designations are ongoing and continue until the employee requests a change or cancellation request in writing.   At any time throughout the year a UIC employee can create, adjust, or cancel their continuous payroll deduction.</li>
    <li><strong>One-time donation:</strong>Employees may give a one-time donation to one or more charities of their choice by completing the One-Time Direct Gift section of the CCFD pledge form. An employee can donate as an individual or a group of employees can combine their efforts and make one larger donation. One Time Direct Gift checks are made payable to &ldquo;Campus Chest&rdquo; and should be submitted with the completed pledge form to UIC Human Resources, Special Programs/CCFD, MC 897.</li>
</ol>
<h2>2018 Campus Charitable Fund Drive Season<a class="jumptag" name="sec05">&nbsp;</a></h2>
<p>The 2018 &ldquo;season of giving&rdquo; will last from <strong>September 17, 2018 through November 19, 2018.</strong></p>
<h2 style="margin-top: 1.6em;">Pledge Forms and Instructions</h2>
<p><strong><a href="https://www.hr.uic.edu/2018CCFDPledgeForm">2018 UIC CCFD Pledge Form</a></strong><a class="jumptag" name="sec07">&nbsp;</a>
<!--<a href="https://www.hr.uic.edu/UserFiles/Servers/Server_2716/File/d_paycheckinfo/2018 CCFD PledgeForm_fillable.pdf">2018 UIC CCFD Pledge Form</a></strong><a class="jumptag" name="sec07">&nbsp;</a>--></p>
<p><strong><a href="https://www.hr.uic.edu/2018CCFDPledgeFormInstructions">2018 UIC CCFD Pledge Form Instructions</a></strong>&nbsp;
<!--<a href="https://www.hr.uic.edu/UserFiles/Servers/Server_2716/File/d_paycheckinfo/2018 CCFD Pledge Instructions.pdf">2018 UIC CCFD Pledge Form Instructions</a></strong><a class="jumptag" name="sec07">&nbsp;</a>--></p>
<p>Continuous payroll deductions and one-time donations can each be made by using the&nbsp;<strong>2018 UIC Campus Charitable Fund Drive Pledge Form.</strong>&nbsp;The Pledge Form Instructions Page will serve as a guide to donors as well as to UIC CCFD Ambassadors.</p>
<p>One-time donations MONEY ORDERS or BANKERS CHECKS are made payable to&nbsp;<strong>&ldquo;Campus Chest&rdquo;</strong>&nbsp;and should be sent with the completed pledge form via campus mail to UIC Human Resources, Special Programs/CCFD, HRB 201B, MC 897.</p>
<p><strong>Continuous payroll deduction forms should be completed, signed, and sent to: UIC Human Resources, Special Programs/CCFD, HRB 201B, MC 897 or faxed to 312-996-6807.</strong></p>
<p><strong>Donations and forms may also be delivered to:</strong><br>
UIC Human Resources, Special Programs<br>
Human Resources Building (HRB)<br>
715 South Wood Street, Room 201B<br>
Chicago, IL 60612</p>
